The claim states that in 2011: the state-run lottery funded New Jersey classrooms by over $930 million.
The expert: s verdict clarifies that while a significant portion of the $930 million did go towards education, not all of it was allocated to classrooms.
According to the state lottery: s annual report, nearly three-quarters of the $930 million went towards education-related initiatives.
The majority of the education funding: over $580 million, was dedicated to higher education, including operating costs for public colleges.
